Lean, effete, and sinister, Vincent Price was among the movies' greatest villains as well as one of the horror genre's most beloved and enduring stars. Born May 27, 1911, in St. Louis, MO, Price graduated from Yale University, and later studied fine arts at the University of London. His tenure at Universal was largely unsuccessful, and the studio kept him confined to supporting roles. Clearly, Price's niche was as a villain -- everything about him suggested malice, with each line reading dripping with condescension and loathing; he relished these roles, and excelled in them. Still, he was not the star Fox wanted; after 1947'ğ’” ğ‘»ğ™ğ’† ğ‘¾ğ™šğ’ƒ, his contract expired and was not renewed. The latter was Price's last theatrical performance for 14 years, however, as he began a very busy and eclectic motion picture schedule.
